### Lignes trigonométriques d'angles associés

::: {.bloc .thm}
<span class="bloc-titre">Théorème : </span><br>
<div style="text-align:center;">
  <img src="../../image/ligne_trigo.png" alt="" width=70%/>
</div>
:::

::: {.bloc .ex}
<span class="bloc-titre">Exemple : </span><br>

1. Déterminer les valeurs exactes du sinus et du cosinus de $-\frac{\pi}{5}$, $\frac{4\pi}{5}$ et $\frac{3\pi}{10}$.  
<details class="bloc cor"><summary>Afficher la correction</summary>
$$
\begin{array}{l|l}
\LH{\cos\left(-\frac{\pi}{5}\right) = \cos \frac{\pi}{5} = \tfrac{1 + \sqrt{5}}{4}} &
\sin\left(-\frac{\pi}{5}\right) = - \sin \frac{\pi}{5} = - \tfrac{\sqrt{10-2\sqrt{5}}}{4}\\[0.6em]
\LH{\cos\frac{4\pi}{5} = \cos \left(\pi-\tfrac{\pi}{5}\right) = - \cos \tfrac{\pi}{5} = - \tfrac{1 + \sqrt{5}}{4}} &
\sin\frac{4\pi}{5} = \sin \left(\pi-\tfrac{\pi}{5}\right) = \sin \tfrac{\pi}{5} = \tfrac{\sqrt{10-2\sqrt{5}}}{4}\\[0.6em]
\LH{\cos\frac{3\pi}{10} = \cos \left(\tfrac{\pi}{2}-\tfrac{\pi}{5}\right) = \sin \tfrac{\pi}{5} = \tfrac{\sqrt{10-2\sqrt{5}}}{4}} &
\sin\frac{3\pi}{10} = \sin \left(\tfrac{\pi}{2}-\tfrac{\pi}{5}\right) = \cos \tfrac{\pi}{5} = \tfrac{1 + \sqrt{5}}{4}
\end{array}
$$
</details>

2. Montrer que $\cos \tfrac{7 \pi}{3} - \sin\tfrac{17\pi}{6} = 0$.<br>
<details class="bloc cor"><summary>Afficher la correction</summary>
On a :
\[
\sin\frac{17\pi}{6} = \sin\left(\frac{7\pi}{3} + \frac{\pi}{2}\right) = \cos\frac{7 \pi}{3}.
\]
Ainsi :
\[
\cos \frac{7 \pi}{3} - \sin\frac{17\pi}{6} = 0.
\]
</details>

1. Montrer que  $\sin^2\!\left(\tfrac{8\pi}{5}\right) + \sin^2\!\left(-\tfrac{11\pi}{10} \right)= 1$.<br>
<details class="bloc cor"><summary>Afficher la correction</summary>
Pour cela, il faut montrer que :
\[
\sin\left(-\frac{11\pi}{10}\right) = \cos\frac{8 \pi}{5}.
\]
En effet :
\[
\sin\left(-\frac{11\pi}{10}\right) 
= \sin\left(\frac{5\pi}{10} - \frac{16\pi}{10}\right) 
= \sin\left(\frac{\pi}{2} - \frac{16\pi}{10}\right) 
= \cos\frac{8 \pi}{5}.
\]
Or, pour tout réel $\alpha$ :
\[
\cos^2 \alpha + \sin^2 \alpha = 1.
\]
Ainsi :
\[
\sin^2\left(\frac{8\pi}{5}\right) + \sin^2 \left(-\frac{11\pi}{10} \right) = 1.
\] 
:::
